javadoc:
ControlFlowGuard is a platform security feature that was created to combat memory corruption vulnerabilities.

ReturnFlowGuard was introduced as an addition to ControlFlowGuard in the Windows 10 Creator's update.

methods.name: markup
methods.comment:
Perform markup on the supported ControlFlowGuard and ReturnFlowGuard functions and 
 tables, if they exist.

methods.name: markupCfgCheckFunction
methods.comment: Performs markup on the ControlFlowGuard check function, if it exists.

params.name: is64bit
params.comment: True if the PE is 64-bit; false if it's 32-bit.

methods.name: markupCfgDispatchFunction
methods.comment: Performs markup on the ControlFlowGuard dispatch function, if it exists.

params.name: is64bit
params.comment: True if the PE is 64-bit; false if it's 32-bit.

methods.name: markupCfgFunctionTable
methods.comment: Performs markup on the ControlFlowGuard function table, if it exists.

methods.name: markupRfgFailureRoutine
methods.comment: Performs markup on the ReturnFlowGuard failure routine, if it exists.

methods.name: markupRfgDefaultFailureRoutine
methods.comment: Performs markup on the ReturnFlowGuard "default" failure routine function, if it exists.

params.name: is64bit
params.comment: True if the PE is 64-bit; false if it's 32-bit.

methods.name: markupRfgDefaultStackPointerFunction
methods.comment: Performs markup on the ReturnFlowGuard verify stack pointer function, if it exists.

params.name: is64bit
params.comment: True if the PE is 64-bit; false if it's 32-bit.

name: ControlFlowGuard
comment:
ControlFlowGuard is a platform security feature that was created to combat memory
 corruption vulnerabilities.
 
 ReturnFlowGuard was introduced as an addition to ControlFlowGuard in the Windows 10
 Creator's update.
